description: Initial reports indicate that an estimated 10,180 people, most of whom are newly arrived IDPs from Sennar State, have been affected by recent heavy rains and flooding in Kassala State. [...] Heavy rains and flooding have also affected an unspecified number of people and homes in Aroma, Shamal Al Delta, Reifi Kassala, and Gharb Kassala localities. [...] Floodwater reportedly submerged tents and water and sanitation (WASH) facilities, as well as roads. The majority of the affected IDPs have been forced to live in the open on the roadsides and they do not have access to food, clean drinking water, or safe sanitation facilities amid heightened concerns of a possible spike in water-borne diseases. ([OCHA, 28 Jul 2024](https://reliefweb.int/node/4081549))
title: Sudan: Floods - Jul 2024
whatHappenings: Here's a summary of the situation in Kassala State, Sudan:
* **Heavy Rains and Flooding:**  Lots of rain caused flooding in Kassala State, Sudan.
* **People Affected:** About 10,180 people were affected, mostly people who had already moved to Kassala from Sennar State.
*  The flooding was especially bad in Kassala State.
*  Other areas affected include Aroma, Shamal Al Delta, Reifi Kassala, and Gharb Kassala.
*  Floodwater covered tents where people lived.
*  Important things like clean water and toilets were also covered by water.
*  Roads were flooded, making it hard to travel.
* Many people had to sleep outside in the rain because their tents were flooded.
*  They don't have enough food, clean water, or safe places to use the bathroom.
*  Doctors are worried that people might get sick because of the lack of clean water.
